pages.title: Rituals 101
pages.text: Performing $(thing)rituals$() is not an easy task. Well, technically speaking it is. But let's pretend it's a hard task that only the chosen ones can perform. $(br)To begin with $(turtlemancy)Rituals$() you need: $(li)A $(item)Turtle Altar$()$(li)x3 $(turtlemancy)Turtles Blessing$() or $(#d63031)Turtles Curse$().

The $(thing)altar$() itself its beautiful, but pretty useless. You have to charge it. To charge the altar you need to feed it with 3 blessings or curses. Once charged the $(thing)Altar$() will take an specific color: blue if its charged with blessings and red if it's charged with curses. $(br2)Some rituals don't care about how you charge the $(thing)altar$(), but some does, so read carefully, $(playername).

pages.title: How to perform a Ritual
pages.text: To perform a ritual you need to do the following:$(li)Charge the altar with the appropiate bless/curse$(li)Put in the altar the appropiate item$(li)Throw near the altar the right items$(li)A sacrifice (if required)
Remember to charge it. Don't make a fool of yourself asking a Turtlemancer why your ritual is not working if you haven't check if it's charged.
